channel.title: USA raises debt ceiling
channel.description:
http://edition.cnn.com/2011/POLITICS/07/31/debt.talks/index.html
As expected, the lower/middle classes will suffer while the upper-class keep their moneys.
Discuss.

item.description:

[quote=“Reaper114, post:70, topic:407644”]Yeah,I love how Obama says “we” need to cut back on spending at home yet congress just took a five week vacation. So I wonder how “we” are supposed yo “cut back” on “our” budget? But Obama isn’t helping much when he goes to every god damn country for a vacation and plays golf constantly and his wife comes back with 2000 dollar dresses but real hard working Americans haven’t had a real vacation in years. All thanks to mere millions to the U.S taxpayer.[/quote]Like any president then. It’s not like he is the only one who does this, media just likes to talk about it more in the US since they’re mostly conservative.

item.title: USA raises debt ceiling
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Niall:

[quote author=Frell link=topic=508921.msg3695614#msg3695614 date=1312410214]What? Obviously republicans wont support most of the stuff Obama pushes, and thats what a balanced congress is supposed to do.

hell I’m a little ignorant of how things work over there(and it’s probably about to show) but damn that seems like a good system[/scarcasm], block what the other guys do on principle, as long as we get the brownie points who cares?!

But Obama didn’t want to cave in even though he had no other option. So he had an option, and had he also vetoed that one and let the country default he could have been impeached.

so he didn’t have an option, then he did??? maybe I’m missing something but that just doesn’t make sense

[/nitpicking]

ps whats so bad about raising the taxes a little, ending tax cuts on the rich? trickle down economics etc no need to explain it to me I know all about it, but quite clearly it isn’t working[/quote]
Im for ending tax cuts on the rich, not raising taxes. Theres tons of little optimizations we can do to fix spending.

Lol no, Obama had no other option than the option to cave in.

Read full topic

item.title: USA raises debt ceiling
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Frell: And that is my point, he used 3.4T$ and got nothing. And then we have not counted the human lives that got lost. And if Bush actions increased the Islamophobia in EU/US and the islamic world’s hate to the western world you get even a bigger cost. But the last thing is only my own speculations, and I can’t really blame Bush for what else happened.

Read full topic

item.title: USA raises debt ceiling
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:

But still it was fanned over a decade (it was still spent though, I wont stand up for him).

Yea I just found that Obamas spending is now at $3.5T. He could have used the stimulus money correctly, and then made cuts and we would be on the road to recovery.

item.title: USA raises debt ceiling
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Actually that article shows that I wasn’t wrong, my source was. Even Obama said $1T.

And Obama has spent 2.9T (hell, it was already 1.5T going into 2010), damn you for making me find my source again.

Doesn’t matter, we’ve talked about this on these forums almost 5 times already.

Read full topic

item.title: USA raises debt ceiling
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:60, topic:407644”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=508921.msg3695632#msg3695632 date=1312410671]
Frell: Again why didn’t Bush or Clinton do anything about it?

And please keep your numbers right.
[/quote]
The numbers are right, i’ve said this numerous times in the past. 9/11 was $1T instantly (actually 1.4T over a week), the wars were $1T over a decade (while also benefiting private industry), and the housing market collapse threw us into the recession.[/quote]
So this is a lie: http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/06/29/us-usa-war-idUSTRE75S25320110629

That is also what you claim Obama spend. (That also is a wrong number)

Read full topic

item.title: USA raises debt ceiling
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:59, topic:407644”]Frell: Again why didn’t Bush or Clinton do anything about it?

And please keep your numbers right.[/quote]
By time Clinton came along the internet boom was fueling everything and the collapse was being covered up. 9/11 happened only a few months into Bush’s first term, which is when the president is most vulnerable and he was preoccupied. And the market collapse was right on the line of Bush/Obama, so really you can’t place it under anyone. I wouldn’t blame Obama either, but I would blame him on fucking up his stimulus that would have worked. Personally I think the damage was already done by time Clinton left, those loans were already given out and soon there would be a collapse.

The numbers are right, i’ve said this numerous times in the past. 9/11 was $1T instantly (actually 1.4T over a week), the wars were $1T over a decade (while also benefiting private industry), and the housing market collapse threw us into the recession.

Not to mention we’re about to hit a double dip recession very very soon.

Read full topic

item.title: USA raises debt ceiling
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Frell: Again why didn’t Bush or Clinton do anything about it?

And please keep your numbers right.

Read full topic

item.title: USA raises debt ceiling
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Niall:

[quote author=Frell link=topic=508921.msg3695518#msg3695518 date=1312406935]So he repeatedly vetoed the republican bill because he wasn’t getting his way.

wait, aren’t the republicans doing the same? you know, blocking everything obama does even if it was their idea originally?

good ol’ us politics[/quote]
What? Obviously republicans wont support most of the stuff Obama pushes, and thats what a balanced congress is supposed to do. But siding with the republicans was the ONLY way to stop the default, because democrats couldn’t get enough votes to push theirs through. But Obama didn’t want to cave in even though he had no other option. So he had an option, and had he also vetoed that one and let the country default he could have been impeached. Before republicans took the house Obama would shut them out anyway.

Niall:

[quote author=Frell link=topic=508921.msg3695518#msg3695518 date=1312406935]Its the fact that Obama has done nothing to stop it.

did bush?

I’d say the wars were pretty significant, and it’s not like some of the raises to the debt ceiling under bush were absolutely necessary, they went to funding the wars as well[/quote]
Both wars totaled $1T over a decade. Obama spent $2.9T over 3 years. The debt ceiling raises under bush were made with ‘promises’ (by congress) that in the future cuts would be made, and congress never made cuts. That is why this time the cuts came with the raise in a nice little bundle.

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:56, topic:407644”][quote author=Frell link=topic=508921.msg3695518#msg3695518 date=1312406935]

Guess what would have happened to Obama

You give him a pretty hard time considering he inherited a real mess from his idiot Republican predecessor.

Its the fact that Obama has done nothing to stop it. And Bush barely caused anything other than the wars. We had 9/11, the wars, and the housing market collapse all under his term, but only the wars under his responsibility.
[/quote]
So the housing market collapse just happened randomly?

Frell: You must admit that this deal was terrible?[/quote]
The housing market collapse originated under carter and was supported by following presidents. It basically pressured banks to give loans to people they normal wouldn’t due to credit or whatever. I can’t stand when people blame the collapse on Bush, or on Clinton. Bush was really only noteable for the wars and tax cuts for the rich.

Read full topic

Its the fact that Obama has done nothing to stop it.

did bush?

I’d say the wars were pretty significant, and it’s not like some of the raises to the debt ceiling under bush were absolutely necessary, they went to funding the wars as well

item.title: USA raises debt ceiling
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:51, topic:407644”][quote author=Frell link=topic=508921.msg3695449#msg3695449 date=1312404638]
Guess what would have happened to Obama
[/quote]
You give him a pretty hard time considering he inherited a real mess from his idiot Republican predecessor.[/quote]
Its the fact that Obama has done nothing to stop it. And Bush barely caused anything other than the wars. We had 9/11, the wars, and the housing market collapse all under his term, but only the wars under his responsibility.

But Obama was shitting bricks because the republican bill had enough votes to pass, but the democrats bill did not. So he repeatedly vetoed the republican bill because he wasn’t getting his way. Had he done that one more time he would have possibly been impeached for letting the country default and ignoring congress.

Read full topic

item.title: USA raises debt ceiling
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:53, topic:407644”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=508921.msg3695462#msg3695462 date=1312404917]

Guess what would have happened to Obama

You give him a pretty hard time considering he inherited a real mess from his idiot Republican predecessor.
[/quote]

he doesn’t give a shit, day 1 of obama being president and the republican goal was/is to make him a one term president

it’s all a game you see, you make the democrats look bad in office so the repubs can get in and vice versa[/quote]
I know all about the political ‘game’. Voting is compulsory in Australia, and that immediately implies compulsory idiocy.
I’m going to go out on a limb here and say that Australian politicians are first class when it comes to talking shit about the opposition, even if they lack their own thought-out policies entirely (which is quite often the case in recent years, heh).

Read full topic
